TableField.name: TrainingClassID
TableField.phrase: Record ID|An automatically assigned number used to track meetings held by the organization

TableField.name: CourseID
TableField.phrase: Record ID|An automatically assigned number used to track training courses available to the organization

ForeignField.name: CourseCode
ForeignField.phrase: Course Code|A unique code used to identify a course offering. A course code can include numbers, letters and special characters; such as, dashes and periods

ForeignField.name: CourseTitle
ForeignField.phrase: Title|A brief name used to identify the course offering
ForeignField.sample: Introduction to Hazard Analysis of Critical Control Points (HACCP)

ForeignField.name: CourseDesc
ForeignField.phrase: Description|A detailed description of the course
ForeignField.sample: The Introduction to Hazard Analysis of Critical Control Points (HACCP) course provides attendees with a working knowledge of company and regulatory product quality requirements. The course also provides attendees with a working knowledge of the company's internal policies and controls deployed to protect consumers from product quality deficiencies.

ForeignField.name: CourseObj
ForeignField.phrase: Objective|A detailed description of the course objective. The course objective should reflect the knowledge expected of attendees as they complete the course
ForeignField.sample: The objective of the Introduction to HACCP course is to provide attendees with the level of understanding required to perform operational duties within a HACCP environment. This course is designed to provide visitors to a HACCP environment with the requisite level of understanding to avoid product contamination behaviors during visitations.

ForeignField.name: TrainingTypeID
ForeignField.phrase: Training Type|A combined field used to describe this training type when associating it with other records

ForeignField.name: TrainingCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Training Category|A word or short phrase used to describe the category of training

CodeField.name: TrainingCategory
CodeField.phrase: Training Category|A word or short phrase used to describe the category of training

ForeignField.name: TrainingTypeDesc
ForeignField.phrase: Training Type Description|A detailed description of the training type
ForeignField.sample: On the job health and safety training should utilize the exact same types of equipment used by an employee during the performance of the job duties being trained.

ForeignField.name: TrainingType
ForeignField.phrase: Training Type|A combined field used to describe this training type when associating it with other records
ForeignField.sample: On the Job | Health and Safety

ForeignField.name: OrgLevelID
ForeignField.phrase: Organization Level|The hierarchical level of the organization

CodeField.name: OrgLevel
CodeField.phrase: Organization Level|The hierarchical level of the organization

ForeignField.name: MinClassSize
ForeignField.phrase: Minimum Class Size|The minimum number of attendees required for a class to be conducted

ForeignField.name: MaxClassSize
ForeignField.phrase: Maximum Class Size|The maximum number of attendees allowed for this course

ForeignField.name: Duration
ForeignField.phrase: Duration|The number of hours required to conduct the course

ForeignField.name: TimeUnitID
ForeignField.phrase: Unit|A combined field used to describe this unit when associating it with other records

ForeignField.name: TimeUnitCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

CodeField.name: TimeUnitCategory
CodeField.phrase: Unit Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group unit types

ForeignField.name: TimeUnit
ForeignField.phrase: Unit|A combined field used to describe this unit when associating it with other records

ForeignField.name: CoursePrep
ForeignField.phrase: Preparation|A detailed description of the preparation required by attendees of the course in advance of class attendance

ForeignField.name: Course
ForeignField.phrase: Course|A combined field used to describe this course when associating it with other records
ForeignField.sample: Introduction to Hazard Analysis of Critical Control Points (HACCP); Leadership; QA-HACCP-101.1

TableField.name: OrganizationID
TableField.phrase: Organization|The organization with primary responsibility for the design, development, and support for this course throughout the enterprise

ForeignField.name: Address
ForeignField.phrase: Address|A combined field used to describe the organization address when associating it with other records

ForeignField.name: Phone
ForeignField.phrase: Phone|Main telephone number of the organization

ForeignField.name: Fax
ForeignField.phrase: Fax|Main fax telephone number of the organization

ForeignField.name: Email
ForeignField.phrase: Email|Main organizational Email address used by the organization to correspond with those outside the organization

ForeignField.name: Organization
ForeignField.phrase: Organization|The organization with primary responsibility for the design, development, and support for this course throughout the enterprise

TableField.name: LocationID
TableField.phrase: Class Location|The location of the scheduled training class

ForeignField.name: LocationTypeID
ForeignField.phrase: Location Type|A combined field used to describe this hazard type when associating it with other records

ForeignField.name: LocationType
ForeignField.phrase: Location Type|A combined field used to describe this hazard type when associating it with other records

ForeignField.name: RoomID
ForeignField.phrase: Room|The room where the training course will be delivered

ForeignField.name: Room
ForeignField.phrase: Room|A combined field used to describe this record when associating it with other records
ForeignField.sample: Packing House Number 3; Cold Storage No. 6; 234

ForeignField.name: Location
ForeignField.phrase: Class Location|The location of the scheduled training class

RemoteField.name: InstructorID
RemoteField.phrase: Primary Instructor|The primary instructor of the training course class

ForeignField.name: Instructor
ForeignField.phrase: Primary Instructor|The primary instructor of the training course class

RemoteField.name: ContactID
RemoteField.phrase: Primary Contact|The primary contact, liaison, and/or registrar for the scheduled class

ForeignField.name: ContactCard
ForeignField.phrase: Contact Card|A combined field used to group basic contact information of a person

ForeignField.name: Contact
ForeignField.phrase: Primary Contact|The primary contact, liaison, and/or registrar for the scheduled class

TableField.name: SpecialPreparation
TableField.phrase: Special Preparation|A detailed description of any special preparation required prior to attending the class. This preparation is in addition to the general preparation associated with the course description
TableField.sample: Enter 25 records into the Hazard Reporting module.

TableField.name: ClassStartTime
TableField.phrase: Start Time|The date and time the training class is scheduled to begin

CalculatedField.name: ClassEndTime
CalculatedField.phrase: End Time|The date and time the training class is scheduled to end. The class end date and time is automatically calculated based on the class begin time and course duration

TableField.name: ClassStatusID
TableField.phrase: Class Status|Present status of the scheduled training class

CodeField.name: ClassStatus
CodeField.phrase: Class Status|Present status of the scheduled training class

TableField.name: IssuesDiscussed
TableField.phrase: Issues Discussed|A detailed description of issues discussed or concerns raised during the training class
TableField.sample: The company says we can refuse to work but when we do they get mad

CombinedField.name: RecordLabel
CombinedField.phrase: Record Label|The short, concise, label of the record for display purposes

CombinedField.name: TrainingClass
CombinedField.phrase: Training Class|A combined field used to describe this training class when associating it with other records
CombinedField.sample: Active Agenda, HQ; Packaging Department Safety Meeting; Employee Safety; 01/01/2004

SampleItem.name: Introduction to Hazard Analysis of Critical Control Points (HACCP)

ViewScreen.phrase: View|View summary information about a meeting

EditScreen.phrase: Form|Edit summary information about a meeting

EditScreen.phrase: Attendees|Assign attendees to the scheduled training class

EditScreen.phrase: Completion|Identify employees that have completed the scheduled training class

EditScreen.name: FileRetention
EditScreen.phrase: Files|Associate physical files and retention methods with the scheduled training course

EditScreen.name: Accountability
EditScreen.phrase: Accountability|Associate accountable people with the scheduled training class

EditScreen.name: Involvement
EditScreen.phrase: Involvement|Associate involved people with the scheduled training class

EditScreen.name: BestPractices
EditScreen.phrase: Best Practices|Associate best practices with the scheduled training class

DocumentationSection.title: Introduction
DocumentationSection.p: The installation-specific introduction to the scope and purpose of this module should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said to introduce this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.title: Implementation
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific implementation rules, policies, practices should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about implementating this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about how this module impacts, or is impacted by, people in general. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.
